Class ec.e.openers.FieldKnife 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.openers.FieldKnife
public final class FieldKnife
extends Object
implements AwakeAfterRevival
'FieldKnife' is loosely based on the 'java.lang.reflect.Field' from the Java 1.1 CRAPI (Core Reflection API).

A FieldKnife opens the instance variables corresponding to a particular instance variable declaration in some class. FieldKnifes are gotten from their base Surgeon, and their point of view derives from it.

awakeAfterRevival()
XXX For now, a FieldKnife simply decodes without authority.
baseOpener()
Describes the class of the object we are declared in
decodeVarFrom(Object, RtDecoder)
Decodes from 'decoder' into this instance variable of 'base'
encodeVarTo(Object, RtEncoder)
Encodes the value of this instance variable value of 'base' onto 'encoder'
get(Object)
Since a FieldKnife is created using information in the Class only (not an instance), you must supply an instance of the object to get the values from.
modifier()
Modifier for this instance variable declaration
name()
The name of this instance variable
opener()
Returns an Opener describing the declared type of this instance variable.
set(Object, Object)
Set the value for a slot (described by FieldKnife) in an object.
signature()
Valid even before activate().
toString()
Maybe this should be more human-readable?

opener 
  public Opener opener()
Returns an Opener describing the declared type of this instance variable. Only valid after activate().
Throws: NullPointerException
if called on a FieldKnife that has not been activated.
awakeAfterRevival 
  public void awakeAfterRevival()
XXX For now, a FieldKnife simply decodes without authority. It instead, it should find the instance variable with its myName and modify its internal state to match, especially myByteOffset. Until myByteOffset is guaranteed to be correct in the restored world, a FieldKnife is too dangerous to be left on.

  public int modifier()
Modifier for this instance variable declaration

Maybe this should be more human-readable?
Overrides:
toString in class Object
get 
  public Object get(Object base)
Since a FieldKnife is created using information in the Class only (not an instance), you must supply an instance of the object to get the values from. In other words, the FieldKnife object describes the slot in the instance, and if you want the value of a slot of an object, then FieldKnife.get(Object o) will return the value of the slot described by FieldKnife in Object o.
Returns:
nullOk, suspect;
Throws: NullPointerException
if called on a FieldKnife that has not been activated.
set 
  public void set(Object base,
                  Object newValue)
Set the value for a slot (described by FieldKnife) in an object. The new value may be a wrapped primitive data type
Parameters:
newValue - nullOk, suspect;
Throws: NullPointerException
if called on a FieldKnife that has not been activated.
